result.execSummary:
The defendant Amos M Godina was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person/Corpse AMENDED FROM ARMED ROBBERY, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.  Firearm prohibition warning given.
Consecutive to: to 12CF1207

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain HSED or GED.   Obtain and maintain full-time employment, attend school full-time or engage in combination of employment and school equal to full-time hours.

Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  No contact with gangs or gang members.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.  No contact with persons using, possessing or selling controlled substances.

superTimeConds.notes: To be served during term of Extended Supervision.

charges.descr: Theft-Movable Property fr. Person/Corpse AMENDED FROM ARMED ROBBERY
